snippet: In a speech, Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. said that, in certain situations, an American citizen thought to be planning attacks on the nation could lawfully be killed.
abstract: Attorney General Eric H Holder Jr, in speech at Northwestern University law school, asserts that it is lawful for the government to kill American citizens without any judicial review if officials deem them to be operational leaders of Al Qaeda who are planning attacks on the United States and if capturing them alive is not feasible.
lead_paragraph: In a speech, Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. said that, in certain situations, an American citizen thought to be planning attacks on the nation could lawfully be killed.
